meanings.definition: Twist or bend out of shape
meanings.sent1: She intorts the wire to create a unique sculpture.
meanings.sent2: The strong wind intorts the tree branches during a storm.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally intorts his straw while sipping his drink.
meanings.sent4: The dancer intorts her body gracefully during the performance.
meanings.sent5: The intense heat intorts the plastic, causing it to warp.

meanings.sent1: The funhouse mirrors intorts our reflections in amusing ways.
meanings.sent2: The artist intorts reality in his surreal paintings.
meanings.sent3: The comedian intorts his face to make funny expressions.
meanings.sent4: The gossip intorts the truth to create drama.
meanings.sent5: The magician intorts reality with his mind-bending tricks.

meanings.sent1: She intorts the lid of the jar to open it easily.
meanings.sent2: The gymnast intorts her body to fit through the narrow space.
meanings.sent3: The cat intorts its body to squeeze through the small gap.
meanings.sent4: The flower intorts its petals as it blooms.
meanings.sent5: The snake intorts its body to fit into the burrow.
